The difficult conversations between Israeli and Palestinian peace activists
subhead: The anti-occupation NGO Combatants for Peace works to organize joint actions between young people living in the West Bank and in Israel. The group faces the challenge of rebuilding trust between both sides, torn apart by two years of war in Gaza.

subhead: With Thursday's announcement of a voluntary national service, President Emmanuel Macron continues to shape the contours of a battle being waged on the fronts of public opinion and national cohesion.

title: Georgia's despondency after a year of protest against the pro-Russian regime
subhead: The protest movement triggered by the halt in Georgia's EU integration now faces an unyielding government. With its top leaders jailed, the opposition warns that the country is sliding into outright authoritarian rule.

title: French conservatives relaunch offensive on Islamism with controversial report
subhead: Following a bill by a right-wing MP to ban the wearing of the headscarf by minors in public spaces, a report by Les Républicains senators sets out 17 recommendations to combat what they describe as 'Islamist ideological infiltration.'

title: Germany pushes ahead to become Europe's leading space power
subhead: Member states of the European Space Agency, meeting in Bremen, approved a €22.1 billion budget for 2026-2028 – a 32% increase. Germany will contribute €5.1 billion, or 23% of the funds, taking on a leadership role in Europe's space program.

Why our old clothes end up in the UAE
subhead: The country has emerged as a leader in sorting secondhand clothing, taking advantage of Europe's inability to process its own stockpiles. This outsourcing comes with clear environmental and social costs.

title: Leaked transcripts unveil Trump envoy's closeness to Russians: 'I have the utmost respect for President Putin'
subhead: Bloomberg has revealed conversations illustrating the close relationship between the Steve Witkoff and his contacts in Moscow.

title: Germany's pension reform becomes a generational conflict
subhead: The plan agreed upon by coalition members is to maintain pension levels despite the aging population. But it is opposed by young conservatives, who are calling for more sweeping reforms.
